meanings.definition: In a bad-tempered or irritable manner.
meanings.sent1: She spoke crabbily to her brother when he interrupted her.
meanings.sent2: The old man always behaves crabbily when he doesn't get his way.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat looked crabbily at the rain outside.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds hung crabbily over the city, threatening a storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice echoed crabbily in the empty classroom.

meanings.sent1: The crabbily expression on her face scared the children.
meanings.sent2: He gave a crabbily response when asked to help with the chores.
meanings.sent3: The crabbily cat refused to play with the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The crabbily sky seemed to mirror his foul mood.
meanings.sent5: Her crabbily attitude made everyone avoid her at the party.
